Situation1: The school reports that the child was caught bullying a classmate, and the parent needs to respond
Expectation2: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation2: You notice a small, contained liquid spill in a walkway that needs to be O39eaned up immediately to prevent slips.
Story: I was just about to grab the mop and clean up the spill near the scaffolding when my phone buzzed in my pocket. It was the school, again. My heart sank as I listened to the message: my son had been caught bullying another kid, and they needed me to come in right away. I could almost hear the disappointment in the principal’s voice, and I pictured my son sitting in the office, waiting for me to show up and make things right. But here, at the site, the foreman had just reminded us how one slip could send someone to the hospital. If I left the spill, someone could get hurt. If I stayed, I’d be the parent who didn’t show up when my kid needed me most. My hands shook as I weighed the hard hat in one hand and my car keys in the other, feeling the pressure of two worlds pulling me apart.
